page.title: 03GRAVEL PITS -BLACK PUDDINGS
page.content: The influence of the early landowners can be seen when the deeds of many of the new and old houses are inspected. Should anyone wish to follow the traditions of forbearers by making their own black puddings - this is prohibited !( One can imagine the looks on the faces of the church congregation when the stench of boiled pigs blood, being mixed with oatmeal, drifted into the church.) The gravel pits were opened in 1947. These border onto the North of the village.Heavy trucks plying from the quarries are banned from using village roads. As pits were abandonded they slowly returned to a natural state.These are now nature conservation zones.However, two areas this year have opened as water sports centres for the general public. Natasha Barlow
